definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Ed's wife is a strong-minded woman and leads him around by the nose.
sentences.chinese: 以德的妻子是一个好强的女生，他什么事都得听她的。

sentences.english: But if Shen Fan has rejected the kindness of a friend.
sentences.chinese: 但是好强的沈凡却拒绝了朋友的好意。

sentences.english: As tough as she is, she has never cried since 13.
sentences.chinese: 好强的她，从13岁后就再也没哭过。

definition: (politics) strongman/(in the workplace, esp. of a woman) a highly capable person/(old) robber
the Way of the Hegemon/abbr. for 霸王之道/despotic rule/rule by might/evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道/overbearing/tyranny/(of liquor, medicine etc) strong/potent
eager to excel/eager to get ahead in life/strong-minded
to concede/to admit defeat/to admit sth is wrong after insisting it is right
not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
